unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in India**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gaining Momentum in India**

unnormalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment is progressing steadily under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), aimed at improving the operational efficiency and financial sustainability of DISCOMs. As of 20/10/2024, approximately 5 million smart meters have been installed across various states, with Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Maharashtra leading the charge.
normalised: New Delhi – The nationwide smart meter deployment is progressing steadily under the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), aimed at improving the operational efficiency and financial sustainability of D I S C O M S. As of twentieth october two thousand and twenty four, approximately five million smart meters have been installed across various states, with Uttar Pradesh, Bihar and Maharashtra leading the charge.

unnormalised: Energy Efficiency Services Limited (EESL) is playing a key role in facilitating the smart meter rollout through its Smart Meter National Programme (SMNP). Consumers are expected to benefit from enhanced energy management and reduced billing errors.
normalised: Energy Efficiency Services Limited (E E S L) is playing a key role in facilitating the smart meter rollout through its Smart Meter National Programme (S M N P). Consumers are expected to benefit from enhanced energy management and reduced billing errors.

unnormalised: “The transition to smart metering is crucial for modernizing our electricity grid,” stated Shri. R.K. Singh, Minister of Power, at an industry event held earlier today. The ministry aims to complete the installation of 250 million smart meters by 31/12/2025. Concerns regarding data privacy and cybersecurity are being addressed through robust security protocols and data localization measures, officials assured. Many DISCOMS are planning awareness campaigns starting 10:00 hrs on 27/10/2024 to educate consumers about the benefits of smart meters. The move will facilitate Time of Day (ToD) tariffs, allowing consumers to reduce bills by shifting consumption to off-peak hours.
